comments:
20020406
1. create a shared launch config - save
2. go to the file and make it empty
3. press 'edit configuration'

you get some of these (i got 11):

only deleting the corrupted file helps

In general we need to be more robust when hanlding invalid XML or corrupt 
launch configs. We do not need to prompt the user more than once - and they we 
should throw away the busted config (i.e. from the cache). We could even 
provide an option to delete it.

Fixed. There is no UI notification, but errors are logged when an invalid 
config is read, and it is removed from the in memory cache. Since this is not a 
common use case, we do not need to prompt the user with notification.
*** Bug 14577 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

traces.message: The  root element is required in a well-formed document.
